chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Dawn M. Hanke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(>3-10g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)2.
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(3)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Full time employment/school/treatment program combination of the 3 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours community service per week.
Absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Participate in and successfully complete Veterans Court Treatment Program;  AODA;  Assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed approrpiate by the dept.;  DNA sample.

Court authorizes transfer to La Crosse Area Veterans Court.

Case Called: 2:05 pm 
INCLUDES 16CF894, 15CF584, 17CF233, AND 17CF240. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Shari Post.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

State moves to: 
In 16CF894: Ct. 2 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF584: Ct. 3 (Manufacture/Deliver Amphetamine/2nd & Subsequent Offense)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 4 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 5 (Manufacture/Deliver Amphetamine/2nd & Subsequent Offense)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 6 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 7 (Manufacture/Deliver Amphetamine/2nd & Subsequent Offense)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 8 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 10 (Maintain Drug Trafficking Place/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 12 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 13 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 17CF233: Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Maintain Drug Trafficking Place/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 4 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 5 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 6 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 17CF240: Ct. 1 (Manufacture/Deliver Amphetamine/Repeater/2nd & Subsequent Offense)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 4 (Maintain Drug Trafficking Place)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 16CF894: Ct. 1 (Deliver Amphetamine/Repeater/2nd & Subsequent Offense)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 15CF584: Ct. 1 (Deliver Amphetamine/2nd & Subsequent Offense)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 9 (Possess with Intent - Amphetamine/2nd & Subsequent Offense)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 11 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 14 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 7 years probation - CONDITIONS: participate in and successfully complete Veterans Court Treatment Program; AODA; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; fulltime employment/school/treatment program combination of the 3 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; repay $420 buy money to MCSD; DNA sample/surcharge (1 surcharge per file); CC. 

COURT find def entitled to 184 days jail credit in 16CF894 and 163 days jail credit in 15CF584. 
COURT authorizes transfer to La Crosse Area Veterans Court. 
COURT signs document authorizing Veterans Court. 
COURT ORDERS $650 cash posted be applied toward $420 buy money and then Court Costs.

BOND MODIFICATION IN 15CF584.
